title: Industry-Linked Problem-Based Learning-Driven Innovation Program for Indian Engineering Education

context.prior_knowledge: Core engineering knowledge and competency in digital tool utilization
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course addressing the mismatch between Indian engineering education and industry demands. Learners (faculty and engineers) develop innovative solutions using digital tools and collaboration platforms while solving real industry problems.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze engineering problems occurring in industrial settings using PBL (Problem-Based Learning) and propose concrete solutions.
Learners can design and implement projects reflecting annual curriculum improvement requirements presented by the FAIR (Faculty-Alumni-Industry-Representatives) Committee.
Learners can develop industry-linked prototypes or products using digital tools (e.g., simulation software, cloud platforms).

resources: Industry collaboration network (corporate mentors, field data)
Digital fabrication equipment (3D printer, IoT kit)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
